column4: How does one loose the Add and Remove button on their Applications menu?
and How does one restore that Add and Remove button?
is it possible to have UbuntuStudio installed on the same machine with ordinary Ubuntu Feisty installed?
is it possible to have UbuntuStudio installed on the same machine with ordinary Ubuntu Feisty installed?
like two different partitions or what?
well say I wanted to be able to have a UbuntuStudio session....is that possible?
not really, I mean there is always a way, but to do so would be heavily involved with scripting and whatnot
ubuntustudio is just some other applications, there really is no reason to
I see.... i just liked the thought of having a session all setup for art and design
to what extent though, like did you want different themes and stuff or just different apps showing up in the menus
more like certain apps being available in that sesion along with a theme and overall unique desktop

the theme part I don't know off hand, I could script something to make the menus change and if I had gnome could hunt around until I found the theme, but unless you are capable of scripting you probably don't want to mess with it
I see... well thanks for your input!
if you are going to obnoxiously repeat every 20 seconds at least have the decency to put your message on one line
what is with you guy??? I am asking a small question here and everyone is acting like I broke the code of Linux Users....
whats with having to have it on one line anyway?.....
1044 users in here, now think in your head what that means
so now that everyone has racked me over the coals of fire with the "thou shalt not's", would anyone care to help me .... please?
OK.... I will ask very sweetly.... dear wonderful bruenig, will you please help me solve this problem I am having?
bash setup.sh
did not work means what
did not work.. did nothing... no error messages ... nothing
well then it must have worked if there were no error messages
